sentences.english: With the temperature dropping rapidly, we couldn't go on with the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 气温急骤下降，我们不能继续实验了。

sentences.english: Due to the sudden narrowness of the estuary, the flood flowed higher and higher.
sentences.chinese: 因河口急骤缩小，洪水流势愈来愈大。

sentences.english: Acute leukemias progress rapidly without treatment.
sentences.chinese: 急性白血病发病急骤无法治疗。

sentences.english: Take a hot sweater, since the sharp drop in temperature in night.
sentences.chinese: 带上一件暖和的毛衣，应该夜间气温会急骤降低。

sentences.english: A swift change had taken place on the earth for him.
sentences.chinese: 在他看来，地球上发生了急骤的变化。

sentences.english: Because the temperature will come down quickly, you should take a warm sweater.
sentences.chinese: 带上一件暖和的毛衣，因为夜间气温会急骤下降。

sentences.english: Suddenly he heard the quick, short click of a horse's hoof behind him.
sentences.chinese: 突然间，他听见背后响起一阵急骤的马蹄的得得声。

sentences.english: It is a common belief that sharp frosts color the autumn leaves.
sentences.chinese: 一般人都以为秋天叶子的颜色是由急骤的霜冻造成的。

sentences.english: Take a warm sweater with you because the temperature at night will fall sharply.
sentences.chinese: 带上一件暖和的毛衣，因为夜间气温会急骤下降。

sentences.english: Conclusion A sudden drop in blood pressure by sublingual Nifedepine may result in or aggravate impairment of brain function.
sentences.chinese: 结论含服硝苯地平降压急骤时，可造成或加重脑损害。

definition: loud sound, such as that of thunder or a bomb/to rumble/to roar
to speed up gradually/faster and faster/(music) accelerando
small craftsman (contemptuous)/clatter (e.g. of footsteps)/jumbled mass/press of bodies/tumult
